intro: Cyanothamnus baeckeaceus subsp. baeckeaceus, commonly known as the Baeckeaceus bluebush, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue to violet flower clusters. The plant produces small, five-lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically arranged in dense, cylindrical inflorescences and are visited by various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is commonly found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
